newsitem.title: INDIA: ADB to lend India $300 mln for core sector bonds.
newsitem.headline: ADB to lend India $300 mln for core sector bonds.

text.p: The Asian Development Bank (ADB) will lend the Indian government $300 million to purchase bonds to fund private sector infrastructure projects, an ADB official said on Wednesday.
Bong-Suh Lee, ADB's vice president (West), told an infrastructure conference the bonds would be sold to Indian domestic investors.
The ADB would provide the funds to the Indian government, which, in turn, would lend the money to financial intermediaries for purchasing the long-term bonds.
Intermediaries such as the Industrial Credit and Investment Corporation of India would purchase the bonds from the private sector to fund infrastructure projects, Lee said.
"They will sell these bonds to domestic investors. The aim is to mobilise India's huge domestic savings," Lee said.
He said the ADB board was due to clear the proposal in November and the bonds would hit the market next year.
Lee did not give any further details.
